Definition.Text: authorized hours, in respect of any location at which customs and excise services may be provided and in respect of any such service, means the hours of service prescribed by the Deputy Minister for that service at that location; (heures autorisées)
Deputy Minister means the Deputy Minister of National Revenue for Customs and Excise; (sous-ministre)
Minister means the Minister of National Revenue; (Ministre)
special services means customs and excise services

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provided at any time upon request by any person therefor and approved by the Deputy Minister,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provided at any time by a person in a supervisory capacity at an establishment licensed under the Excise Act or at a bonded warehouse, or

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the acceptance outside authorized hours of reports from operators of aircraft, trains, vessels or motor vehicles, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the examination of persons and the examination and release or other disposition of goods conveyed on aircraft, trains, vessels or motor vehicles,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: services provided by an officer at a distillery, brewery, tobacco manufactory, cigar manufactory or a tobacco packer licensed under the Excise Act during a regular 8-hour period prescribed by the Deputy Minister for each day of the week except Saturday and Sunday and any holiday,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the examination or documentation at any time of military aircraft, vessels or motor vehicles, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the examination of the effects of a settler or a returning resident of Canada during authorized hours at a destination within a port area. (services spéciaux)

Subsection.Text: Every person for whom a special service is provided shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pay in respect of that service a charge of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the first 2 hours or portion thereof $54; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each hour or portion thereof in excess of 2 hours $27; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide or pay for the transportation and living expenses of, and suitable accommodation for, each officer required to render such service.

Subsection.Text: Where more than one officer is engaged in performing a special service, the time spent in performing that service is, for the purposes of this section, the aggregate of the time spent by all the officers so engaged.

Section.Text: If the chief officer of customs for the place or area in which a special service is to be performed is of the opinion that security is required to guarantee the payment of charges incurred in providing that service, the person requesting that service must give security in accordance with the requirements of the Financial Security (Electronic Means) Regulations and in an amount determined by the Minister.
